comments:
The behaviour described here seems to be a side effect of the move to use EMF 2.3.

To reproduce, create a new element using the outline view. The element is added properly but the exception shown below is added to the log. Trying to undo the operation will result in a partial undo.

Nitin, 
If you can take a quick look I'd appreciate it. 
I'm wondering if there is something we should fix, or, if its a change in EMF we should report?
The EMF compound command seems to have been changed. See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=148019

Created an attachment (id=53976)
Tentative patch

It seems the compound command was executed too soon. It should only be executed once the fRecordingCount reaches zero. This patch seems to fix the immediate issue but there may be more to it than meets my untrained eye.

Appending to the compound command after it has already been tested for executability (or worse yet, after it has been executed) is definitely a usage error. The appended command may not be tested for executability and that may leave it unprepared to execute correct, may even execute something that's not executable at all, or may add a command that will be undone but was never done in the first place. So I'm sorry for the change in behavior, but it's likely uncovering a lurking problem or perhaps is just uncovering a usage error that happened not to cause any problem in the first place.

I ran into this same problem, except I got it when I was using content assist.
1. prompt for content assist
2. type a letter to filter out the list of proposals
3. select a proposal and hit enter

I get the following in the log:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.sse.core 4 4 2006-11-16 17:32:43.978
!MESSAGE The command is already prepared
!STACK 0
java.lang.IllegalStateException: The command is already prepared
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.command.CompoundCommand.append(CompoundCommand.java:563)
	at org.eclipse.wst.sse.core.internal.undo.StructuredTextUndoManager.createNewTextCommand(StructuredTextUndoManager.java:324)

Valantin's patch looks correct to me. 

I think the only reason it worked before was that there is a check in in 
BasicCompondStack that if a command was already executed, it would not execute again. 

So, there may have been fringe cases that were not undoing/redoing correctly, or may be some odd cases that will now be broken, but Valantin's solution is conceptually correct, so I'll put this in our M3, since undo is badly broken without it.

released to M3 build > 11/16 23:00

Thanks Valentin for the quick patch. 

Thanks Ed for the confirming remarks.

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP defects already verified by the reporter but awaiting closure by the assignee.  If you feel this defect was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
